page.title: 05TRANSPORT IN CROOK,CUMBRIA
page.content: PUBLIC TRANSPORT IS INFREQUENT AND CONSISTS OF A TWICE DAILY BUS SERVICE, LIABLE TO SUSPENSION DURING SCHOOL HOLIDAYS. ON THE CLOSURE OF THE VILLAGE SCHOOL IN 1984,THE COUNTY EDUCATION DEPARTMENT FOR SCHOLARS FROM THE AGE OF FIVE TO BE TRANSPORTED BY TAXIS FROM VARIOUS POINTS TO THE VILLAGE SCHOOL AT STAVELEY,A DISTANCE OF 3 OR 4 MILES,AND RETURNED AFTER SCHOOL.ONE PUPIL IS TAKEN BY TAXI TO STAVELEY TO CATCH A SERVICE BUS FROM THERE TO WINDERMERE.OTHER PUPILS EITHER USE THE PUBLIC SERVICE BUS OR ARE TAKEN IN BY PARENTS OR FRIENDS. THE AREA HEALTH AUTHORITY ORGANISE A VOLUNTARY HOSPITAL CAR SERVICE TO TAKE OUT-PATIENTS AND THE ELDERLY TO HOSPITALS,CHIROPODISTS AND TO THE DAY CENTRE IN KENDAL FOR THERAPY.
